metadata.title: CVE-2017-18641 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In LXC 2.0, many template scripts download code over cleartext HTTP, andomit a digital-signature check, before running it to bootstrap containers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18641` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblxc-common - 3.0.4-0ubuntu2
liblxc1 - 3.0.4-0ubuntu2
libpam-cgfs - 3.0.4-0ubuntu2
lxc - 3.0.4-0ubuntu2
lxc-utils - 3.0.4-0ubuntu2
lxc1 - 3.0.4-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lxc-templates package in focal is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
lxc package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.4-0ubuntu2').
